result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandro Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, and supervision fees.  To be paid by monthly payments during the duration of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No alcohol or drugs.
Do not be at any places where illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No association with known drug users or dealers.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

Advise any doctor of drug offense before being prescribed any medications.
Cooperate with any program deemed necessary by the probation department.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for any violation including positive drug test: 1st offense to serve 5 days; 25 days for the second, 90 days for the third.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alejandro Cruz in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 1 day time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs without a valid prescription
-maintain part time employment and school
- DO NOT be at any places where illegal drug are sold, distributed or used
- No Association with known drug users or dealers.
-Advise any doctor of drug offense before being prescribed any medications
-pay all court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, and supervision fees by making monthy payments during duration of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment/tax intercept being entered

Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 months imposed and stayed condition time if defendant has any violation including positive drug test: 
1st Offense: 5 days to be served at House of Corrections, 2nd Offense: 25 days to be served at House of Corrections, 3rd Offense: 90 days to be served at House of Correction.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice to Seek Post Conviction Relief received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Vincent Guimont for attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was put on the court's calendar from intake court.  Defendant has a valid prescription.  Court takes no action.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point  Case Worker Elise Josephson.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Court adjourns matter to the trial Court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court addresses violation report dated 9/2/2014.  The defendnat has reported to Justice Point and is compliant.  Court takes no action.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed telephone contact.  aw

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alejandro Cruz in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on 11/5/2014 at 8:30 am, in Branch 3.  Court orders defendant to make all contacts with Justice Point.  Defendant to make contact with Justice Point within 24 hours of being released from custody.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed.  

Count 1:  Possession of tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(e).  A unclassified misdemeanor.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Elise Josephson.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for on Plea and Sentencing August 27, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 3

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Violation report received and filed.  Defendant tested postive for Cocaine and Opiates.  Defendant to bring in verification of prescription.  If defendant has another positive test, court will modify bail.  Court is increasing defendant's supervision with Justice Point to ENHANCED.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant to go Justice Point now, and return after court.  Case passed to the afternoon.  aw

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant showed up late.  Court cancels warrant previously ordered, and reinstates signature bond.  Court orders defendant to make all court appearances on time.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court orders signature bond forfeited.  Remand to Judge.  

Note:  NO warrant printed.  Defendant showed up later in the morning.

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense cousnel requests time to go over case with client.  Case adjourned for scheduing conference on 6/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alejandro Cruz in court with student intern Trisha Fritz under the supervision of Richard Carpenter for attorney Debra J Patterson.  Nathaniel Adamson for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (4/25/14). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
